His dream is to own several passenger vehicles and ensure that all his children are professionals.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and purchase fruits and vegetables with the rest

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 57, married and has four children, ranging in age from 8 to 30. He describes himself as a visionary. He operates a retail and tailoring store  where he sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, sodas and clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located within a business area with high potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy a sewing machine for his tailoring business. His business goal is to be selling dresses wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, his business will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Rev Norah

texts.en:
Rev Norah is 36 years old, married and has two children.She sells shoes and has been in the business for the past year. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from her business.

This is her first term loan with Kadet Ltd. She was introduced to Kadet by a field officer. She will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of clothes for resale in her business. She hopes to purchase a plot of land where she can start farming.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Zelita

texts.en: Zelita, 38. is married with three children and lives in Deboloc, Plaridel, Philippines. Zelita owns and operates a plot of farmland, raising bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns PHP 6,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Zelita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. In the future, Zelita's plan is to save her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and married with five children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general (sari-sari) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and vegetables, raising pigs and chicken and food vending.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti is a very hard working woman who is married with two children, one of whom is in school. Her primary activity and source of living has been selling dishes in a café for the last five years. Demand for more variety of foods is increasing every day. She, however, faces a deficit of capital and therefore decided to visit Yehu offices to ask for a loan of KSH 50,000 to purchase utensils, furniture, and bales of wheat flour. She makes sure that her customers do not get offended and that they get what they want. Binti has one helper but hopes to expand her café and hire more employees in the future. She is a dedicated entrepreneur who always looks for new opportunities so that her family lives a life that is worth living.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, furniture, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en: Alvina is 35 years old and comes from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with seven children. Her eldest is 15 and her youngest is 4 years old. Alvina and her husband have been engaged in their fishing business for 15 years now. This is her main livelihood to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, wood and nylon. These will be helpful so they can catch more than before with the use of a new and sturdy fishing net. The income that they will generate from fishing will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, wood and nylon

loans.name: Geseley

texts.en:
Geseley is 53 years old and married with one child.

Geseley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Geseley has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from hog raising.

Geseley aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
Yuliana es una joven madre de familia de 21 años de edad, tiene ahora dos hijos y continúa viviendo en la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. Ella había solicitado a Kiva un crédito anteriormente para mejorar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales.

Después del crédito brindado, muchas cosas en su vida han mejorado, en primer lugar ya tiene un hijo más y también pasa más tiempo junto a su esposo, ya que este ha conseguido un nuevo trabajo cerca a la zona en donde residen. Su comunidad aún se encuentra esperando el acceso a los principales servicios básicos (agua y electricidad) para poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida.

Por otro lado, en cuanto a su negocio, ella continúa dedicándose a la crianza y venta de ovejas y aves de corral, tratando siempre de conseguir alimentos de mejor calidad para lograr que desarrollen saludablemente y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, en cuanto a las ovejas, su esposo le ayuda llevándolas a pastar a zonas en donde pueden encontrar pastos naturales. Adicionalmente ha empezado a comercializar prendas de vestir entre los habitantes de la zona. Con estos ingresos y los que provee el trabajo de su esposo, esperan sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y brindarles una mejor educación y calidad de vida.

Yuliana se encuentra solicitando nuevamente un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de alimentos balanceados y un lote de mercadería en ropa de invierno. Con estas acciones ella planea seguir creciendo como empresaria.

Yuliana se encuentra muy contenta y bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella en su anterior préstamo, del mismo modo, agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Yuliana is a young, 21 year old wife andmother. She now has two children and continues to live in a rural area of the district of Tambogrande. She asked Kiva for a loan before improve her business raising and selling animals.  

After the loan that was offered, a lot of things in her life improved. In the first place, she has another child and she also spends more time with her husband, since he got a new job close to the area where they live. Her community is still awaiting access to the main basic services (water and electricity) to obtain a better quality of life. 

On the other hand, in her business, she continues to raising and selling sheep and poultry, always trying to get better quality feed so they can develop healthily and be sold at a better price. Her husband helps her with the sheep, taking them to pasture in areas where they can find natural fodder. In addition, she has started to sell clothing to the area residents. With this income and that from her husband's job, they hope to get their children ahead and offer them a better education and quality of life.

Yuliana is again asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that she's planning on using to buy balanced feed and a lot of winter clothing merchandise. With these actions, she plans to keep growing as a businesswoman. 

Yuliana is very happy and grateful to the people who cooperated with her with her previous loan. In the same way, she is grateful in advance to the people who will help her at this time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and a lot of winter clothes merchandise.

loans.name: Shixali

texts.en: Shixali is a 55-year-old man on a pension. He is married with three children. He raises cattle and sells them to local butchers right from his home. Shixali has more than 20 years of experience in this field – thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle. Shixali usually buys calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and resells them at profit in the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings in 130 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. There is only one source of income in the family and this is not enough to cover the basic needs of the beloved children. Shixali applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase three baby calves. This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en: Sros lives in a village of the Dambae district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. He is 44 years old and a married father of three children. Two daughters are living with him and helping the family’s business. He has been working as a farmer on one hectare of farmland, growing paddy rice as his primary source of income. Additionally, he also grows cassava on another one hectare plot to better feed the family. His average earning per day is 16,000 KHR. Sros is In a group consisting of two members. It is first loan for Sros and his group member with VisionFund. They are applying for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. As the group leader, Sros is going to use his loan’s portion to pay the weeding fee for his cassava field and he will use another portion of it to plant rubber tree seedlings to earn more income. He hopes to receive more crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay the weeding fee for his farmland and to buy rubber tree seedlings.

loans.name: Yeva

texts.ru:
Ева живет в небольшом городке Хуст, Западная Украина. Она торгует мелкими товарами, а именно носочками, нижним бельем, колготками, чулками. Ева работает не так давно, начала торговать всего год назад. Место для торговли пока только арендует. На данный момент у нее в товаре около 10 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет около 2 800 гривен.  

Еве необходим кредит суммой 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести партию детских и мужских носков и детского белья, которые летом являются самым ходовым товаром. Полученные от реализации этой партии товара средства, Ева планирует вложить в свой бизнес и улучшение условий проживания своей семьи. На заработанные средства Ева хотела бы закупить затем товар высшей категории, а на зиму взять в аренду место в закрытом помещении, где-то в одном из магазинов.
texts.en:
Yeva lives in a small town of Khoost in the Western Ukraine. She sells small items such as socks, underwear, tights and stockings. Yeva has not been working long, she started selling just a year ago. She is renting her vendor space for now. At this time she has around 10,000 invested in her inventory. Her clean profit is around 2,800 hryvnia.

Yeva needs a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia so she can buy a batch of children's and men's socks and children's underwear, which is a high commodity during the summer. Yeva plans to invest the received profit from the sale of this merchandise into her business and to improve the living conditions of her family. She wants to use the earned income to buy a higher quality merchandise and also rent a space in the indoors in one of the stores for the winter.

loans.use: to buy a batch of men's and children's socks and children's underwear.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is a 40-year-old woman from Kisumu, married to Kephas, who is a farmer. They have four children, ages 15, 11, 10 and 8 years old.

Benter sells fruits – a business she has done for the last 15 years. She makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) and is taking out her second loan from KADET Ltd for 50,000 KES. She intends to add more stock with sacks of oranges, mangoes, grapes and apples. She will use her profits to expand the business and pay off her loan well. Her dream is to own a very big stall in town.

loans.use: to buy sacks of oranges, mangoes, grapes and apples to sell

loans.name: Marnilita

texts.en:
Marnilita is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marnilita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her store. She has been in this business for 32 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Marnilita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 40 years old and married with one kid. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods and other grocery products.

Ma. Fe has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Ma. Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like snack foods, canned goods and other grocery products.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Helen has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from sugarcane, raising pigs and water buffalo and scrap iron retailing.

Helen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a small basket weaving business for about ten years now. Basket weaving also known as basket making is the process of weaving unspun vegetable fibers or young bamboo grass into a basket or other similar form. People and artists who weave baskets are called basketmakers and basket weavers. This business gives Nonita the income that she needs to support the family. 

However, Nonita is in need of additional funds for her business to grow and become more sustainable. Nonita is applying for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as nylon, rope and  bamboo sticks. She believes that this loan would be a great help for her to realize her dreams especially for the education of her children.

Nonita dreams of nothing but to live a full life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as nylon, rope, and bamboo sticks

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Age 26, Phalla is a young mother of one daughter and one son. Both of them are still her responsibility, as they are still enrolled in school. For her family's sake, especially the children, she has been growing paddy rice and cassava for 10 years to support the entire household. From her businesses, she can earn about 22,000 riels (KHR) per day. 

Phalla and the other group member, Chanthy, are new to VisionFund. Phalla, the group leader, is seeking 800,000 KHR. She is going to use her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer. She will also use some of it to pay for plowing. She hopes to grow her cassava in time, while the price is high, so that she can earn more income to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Lucia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, soap, canned goods, etc. In the future Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Verna

texts.en:
Maria Verna is 27 years old and married with one child.

Maria Verna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Maria Verna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening, farming sugarcane and corn.

Maria Verna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 39 years old and married with three children.

Mildred works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Mildred has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from ice cream vending, farming sugarcane, peanuts and corn, retailing gasoline and rice vending.

Mildred aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa is married with two children. Leonisa is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and she cultivates bananas for a living. She has been doing this for four years and every month she earns 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Leonisa joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Leonisa hopes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rafaelo

texts.en:
Rafaelo is 63 years old, married and has six children. She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Rafaelo requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Rafaelo has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rafaelo would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.fr: Sylvestre est un jeune homme de 25 ans célibataire sans enfant. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 2 ans où il vend des vêtements des jeunes et des dames. à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les v^ vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir sa boutique de vêtements.
texts.en: Sylvestre is a 25-year old single man without children. He has been working as a vendor at the local market for two years, selling children’s and women’s clothing. Because he is short on capital, he is forced to purchase clothing items every weekend, at retail prices, before displaying them on his stand. This does not bring in much revenue, which is why it is so important for him to receive a loan allowing him to purchase a bale of mixed clothing. He will save the revenues made possible through this loan in order to expand his clothing business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and food vending. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to  purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 45-year-old married man. He has a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be focused and sensitive. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located within a high-potential business area and his primary customers are hotels and retail shops. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of milk for resale. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more milk for resale. His business goal is to improve his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children with the generated profits.

loans.use: to buy more milk for resale

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is 72 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for 20 years and also earns additional income from peanut retail. Shirley is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 59 years old and married. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been fattening pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and farming sugarcane and corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman who is in her late 20’s. She has two bouncing children who are attending school. Mwanasha earns a living by operating a food stall, which has been active for the last three years, selling to the general public. She is a very hardworking person who works from morning to late in the evening, earning approximately Ksh 500 a day. Her husband is not working and therefore they operate this stall together. 

Despite this low income, they don’t give up and they always ensure that their children have all the basic needs. Mwanasha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Demand for more food variety has arisen and she lacks enough stock of merchandise, so she is requesting a loan from Yehu and Kiva Partners so as to purchase bales of wheat flour, rice, and sugar. This will let her continue to offer good service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ada works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and from a general store. Ada is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending. Editha is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing boat maintenance.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing boat maintenance

loans.name: Minovar

texts.en: Minovar is a woman full of positive energy. She has owned an animal husbandry business for more than 18 years. She has enough experience to develop business. She buys cattle, cares for it, and then sells it to local people at a low price. She has many customers in the local market. She must work hard because she is a widow and needs to comfort her two children with all the necessary things by herself. Her older son helps her with the business. She is asking for a loan to buy young cattle to develop her business. She awaits your support. You are the only one who can help her.

loans.use: To buy cattle to develop her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

NWTF is listing Marites's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like soap, detergent and other grocery products.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soap, detergent and other grocery products.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Tomasita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Tomasita is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more chicken and frozen foods for her business.

Tomasita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and frozen foods for her business.

loans.name: Armik

texts.en: Armik is involved in farming. She keeps chickens, grows peach and walnut trees, and keeps a grape orchard. In order to improve conditions in the orchard and exploit the land she has applied for this loan to get sufficient funds. With the requested amount Armik plans to purchase fertilizer and poles and cords for the grape orchard. As Armik lives with her husband, Surik, it's hard for them to do all the work themselves. So Armik also plans to hire a few workers. This loan will help Armik to keep stable development of her farm and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, poles, cords and for hired workers

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en: Deolita is married and has three children. She is 42 years old, and resides at Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte: Philippines. Deolita cultivates coconuts to sell for a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2011, Deolita joined GDMPC. In the future, Deolita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 38 years old and married with 3 children. Liezel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Liezel has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from fishing.

Liezel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Léopold René

texts.fr: Léopold René est marié et père de cinq enfants dont quatre sont scolarisés. L'aîné a 19 ans et le benjamin 09 ans. Léopold René a une boutique où il vend des boissons de la SOBEBRA, de la cigarette, des biscuites et d'autres articles depuis 07 ans. Il fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et veut acheter des amuses gueules, des casiers de boissons SOBEBRA et des boîtes de conserves. Le bénéfice généré par son activité lui permettra d'assurer une bonne formation à ses enfants et de renforcer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: Léopold René is married and the father of five children, of whom four are in school. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 9. Léopold René has had a store for seven years selling beverages from the SOBEBRA, cigarettes, cookies, and other goods. He stocks up from one of the markets of Benin and wants to buy tasty treats, cases of SOBEBRA beverages, and canned foods. The profit generated by his business enables him to ensure his children are well-educated and to bolster his working capital.

loans.use: to buy 6 cases of beverages, 12 containers of tasty treats, a box of sugar, and a box of canned food

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad tiene 53 años está casada con el señor Cervando tienen 3 hijos de los cuales dos son independientes y la hija menor está estudiando una carrera técnica, la señora Felicidad vive en la comunidad de la Villa de la provincia de Punata, viven en su casa propia y su principal actividad es la producción de la lecha cruda, cuenta con cabezas de ganado lechero cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos y el esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en la misma zona donde viven cuentan con varias parcelas de terrenos agrícolas donde produce Cebolla, Papa y haba, a pesar de su edad ambos siguen trabajando mucho. El destino del crédito es la para la compra de forraje, ya que esta temporada hay bastante escases de forraje y lo que la cliente desea es acumular y de esa manera no tendrá escases de forraje en la temporada de sequía y su ganado tendrá la misma alimentación y continuara produciendo la misma cantidad de leche. Entre sus mentas esta ver a la hija con una carrera profesional para que ella pueda tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Felicidad is 53 years old and married to Cervando, and together they have 3 children, two of whom are independent, while their youngest daughter is studying a technical career.  Felicidad lives in the town of La Villain the province of Punata, where they live in their own home, and her principal activity is the production of raw milk.  She has several head of cattle for milking, whose products she takes to a company that is involved in the production of dairy products, and her husband works in agriculture.  In the same region where they live, they have several parcels of agricultural land which produce onions, potatoes, and broad beans.  In spite of their age, they continue to work long hours.

The intended purpose of the loan is for buying fodder, since it's the time of year when there is a scarcity of natural fodder, and what her customer wants is an increase in production, and in this way she will avoid a shortage of fodder during the dry months and her cattle will have the same nutrition and continue to produce the same amount of milk.  Among her goals is to see her daughter find a white-collar career for that she will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fodder to improve the nutrition of her cattle.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: El sr. Filemon tiene 54 años de edad él vive en la población de chimore, de la provincia carrasco, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él se encuentra casado con la sra. Graciela con la cual tiene 2 hijos,  Filemon se dedica ala venta de medicina natural, producción de plátano, venta de pollos, venta de cítricos y su esposa a la venta de Abarrotes no tuvo ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, él se volvió a levantar  junto a su esposa tomo un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezó de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Filemon es para la construcción de tinglado para granja de porcinos y compra de bomba de agua y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar alguna carrera sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar una carrera, pero él quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Filemon is 54 years old and lives in the town of Chimore, in the province of Carrasco and the city of Cochabamba.  He is married to Graciela, and they have two children.  Filemon is working in the sales of natural medicine, growing plantains, chicken sales, and the sales of citrus fruits.  Meanwhile, his spouse sells groceries.  He didn't have enough income to support his family, so he went to his spouse and they decided they could try again and together they set a new course for their life's path and started over from zero.

The loan that Filemon is asking for is for the construction of a shed for raising pigs and to buy a water pump, and in this way he will make a profit and be able to help his children to finish their schooling.  He dreams of a better future for his children, since he was never able to finish advanced schooling, but he hopes that his children will finish their schooling and be able to help people in their neighborhood.

loans.use: to build a shed for his farm and to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr Jorge tiene 29 años, es comerciante hace más de 6 años. Vive en la ciudad de  Coronel Oviedo, esta acompañado con la Sra Mirta y tienen un hijo de tres años, por quien luchan mucho, para poder darle lo que necesita para una buena vida.
Comenta que comenzó desde muy abajo, anteriormente solamente trabajaba en una Heladería como secretario donde aprendió todo como fabricar Helados. Hace mas o menos tres años que se animo con su Señora y abrieron para su propia fábrica de Helados, y gracias a Dios tuvo mucho éxito. Ahora cuenta con un local propio y todas las maquinarias necesarias para la fabricación, además tiene varios congeladores distribuidas en diferentes negocios de la zona de Coronel Oviedo.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de  Chapas y Varillas para Agrandar su local, ya que está creciendo y quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el cual es el medio de ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 29 years old and has been a businessman for over 6 years.  He lives in the city of Coronel Oviedo together with by Mirta and they have a three year old child, for whom they fight hard to give her what she needs for a good life.

He says that he started working from very little.  In the past he just worked in an ice cream store as a secretary where he learned everything about making ice cream.  About three or so years ago, with the encouragement of his sweetheart, they opened their own ice cream making shop, and thanks to God he has had great success.  He now has one location of his own and all of the necessary machines for production, and also he has various distribution freezers in different businesses around the township of Coronel Oviedo.

He is asking for a loan to buy sheets of laminate and rods to expand his ice cream shop, since it is is a growing business and he wants to continue investing in his business, which is a means of helping out his family.

loans.use: to buy sheets of laminate and rods to expand his ice cream shop.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Maria de 43 años. José es macatero, es decir vende productos de forma ambulante desde hace más de diez años. Cuenta que su esposa también lo ayuda con los gastos, ya que ella es artesana y hace sobrecamas, los cuales el vende.
José es muy sacrificado debido a que su mama falleció cuando era muy joven, y él es el mayor y único varón entre sus hermanos, y tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para poder ayudarles. José la venta lo realiza casa por casa, recorriendo varios kilómetros en su motocicleta, hoy en día le ayuda su esposa en la fabricación de la artesanía.
José quiere surtir su stock de productos y solicita el crédito para poder comprar sabanas, zapatos, prendas y demás, con lo cual tendrá buena variedad que podrá ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, and married to Maria, who is also 43 years old.  José is a door-to-door salesman, which is to say that he sells products on foot and has been doing so for over ten years.  he says that his wife also helps him with the household expenses, as she is a craftswoman and makes bedcovers, which she sells.

José is a very selfless person because his mother died when he was very young, and he was the oldest and the only male among his siblings, and he had to work from the time he was very young in order to help them.  José makes his sales by going house to house, traveling several kilometers on his motorcycle, and he currently helps his wife in the creation of her handiwork.

José wants to refill his supply of products and is asking for a loan to buy sheets, shoes, clothing, and more, which will give him a good variety that he will be able to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sheets, shoes, garments, and more.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora María de 50 años de edad, es madre soltera vive con sus seis hijos en su casa dos de ellos ya son independientes, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace tres años, en su negocio ella atiende gran parte de los vecinos de su comunidad y sus alrededores, en su negocio dos de sus hijas le apoyan a vender y atender a sus clientes.
Doña María solicita el préstamo para comprar frescos, maíz, frijoles, arroz, manteca, jabón, aceite, condimentos, detergente, pollo, carne, azúcar, harina, café, etc.
Con el apoyo del préstamo Doña María mejorara sus ingresos y su pulpería tendrá mas productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y por lo consiguiente obtendrá mas ganancias.
Para Doña María su deseo es mejorar su negocio hacerlo mas grande, mas rentable y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and a single mother who lives with her six children in her home, though two of them are now of age.  She has worked at her corner store for the past three years.  In her business, she waits on the majority of her neighbors from her community and the surrounding ones, and in her business, two of her daughters help her to make sales and wait on her customers.

María is asking for this loan in order to buy  drinks, corn, beans, rice, lard, soap, oil, condiments, detergent, chicken, meat, sugar, flour, coffee, etc.

With the aid of this loan, María will improve her income and her corner store will have more products to offer her customers, so consequently she will make greater profits.

For María, her wish is to improve her business and make it larger, more profitable, and improve the conditions her family lives in.

loans.use: to buy juices, corn, beans, rice, lard, soap, oil, condiments, detergent, chicken, meat, sugar, flour, coffee, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a sewing expert and sews clothes for her neighboring clients to financially support her family.

She has two sons. Both of them are young and continuing their education.

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery selling business. With the loan investment, her husband will put a larger stock of grocery items in his shop that will help him complete the client orders and fulfill their demand.

He is very experienced in his work and has been operating his business for many years.

Rani is confident that he will successfully be able to improve his business after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rani.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for the grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old and has seven children. 

Lilia is in the agricultural business and farms vegetables in the Philippines. Lilia requested an 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming vegetables for seven years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from gasoline and charcoal retail.

Virginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. Rachelle is a farmer, and she cultivates bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years and every month she earns 4,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for farm maintenance. 

Rachelle been a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Rachelle hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

location.town: San Roque, Rizal Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase refrigerators, a hot dog-maker and stock for her store.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from six to 21 years of age. She describes herself as a quiet and focused woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, snacks and tea. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a town and her primary customers are local residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy maize to start a new shop. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntuya, 32, lives with her husband and her two younger children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. She is a tailor and works in the leather clothes factory in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been doing her job for seven years and her salary does not meet her family's expenses. Her husband, Erdenebat, 32, is a builder and does not earn enough money. 

This time she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of new sheep wool felt covering for her old ger. In winter her ger becomes cold because it does not have a good covering. Her two children always have flu due to the cold at home. Her choosen ger cover is made from traditional sheep wool and is insulated with breathable material which holds the warmth for a long time. She knows that with this cover, it will cost less to heat the house with coal in the future. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of purchasing the new ger cover so it stays warm in her house and so as to reduce the smoke to the air from her ger.

loans.use: to purchase a new ger cover to keep warm at home and to reduce the smoke in the air from her ger.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is widowed and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Lolita has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from egg retail.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is a 43-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has four young children aged 14, 13, 10 and five years old. Necitas is in the food-vending and hog-raising business. She sells food to the people in her community and also raises hogs in her backyard. Her husband works as a carpenter. These are the sources of their income.

Necitas works hard in order to give support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the education of their children. Necitas is applying for a loan of 4,000 PHP to  buy new piglets to raise and to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Necitas dreams of making her business productive so that it will augment their income.

loans.use: to buy new piglets to raise and to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 34, is married with three children and resides in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She cultivates coconuts to sell for a living, a business she has been in for two years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of business.

Mary Ann has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to pay for farm maintenance. She joined GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Mary Ann wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora María, tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Doña Dora María, tiene un taller de costura y serigrafía, confecciona camisetas y hace el estampado con serigrafía. Ella anteriormente trabajo en una maquila donde adquirió mucha experiencia, la cual está poniendo en práctica. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y sus clientes llegan hacer los pedidos allí. Con el préstamo que solicita de 21,000 Lempiras va comprar tela y materiales para confeccionar camisetas con diseños de serigrafías. Su  plan es hacer crecer el negocio como una empresa para que su familia tenga una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Dora María is 50 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Doña Dora María has a sewing and serigraph workshop where she produces T-shirts and adds designs on them through screen printing. She previously worked at a factory where she acquired a great deal of experience that she is putting into practice. Her business is established in her home and her customers come to her whenever they need to place orders.

With the loan of 21,000 HNL that she is requesting, Dora María will buy fabric and materials for making T-shirts with screen-printed designs. Her plan is to grow her business like a company so that her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for making screen-printed T-shirts.

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en:
Delgermaa, 28, is a Korean translator and she has been working in a translation bureau since 2007. Her husband works as a butcher in the supermarket. They live with their kids in an old house which was built at the end of the socialist era in Mongolia. Since then, it has not had any major repairs or plasterwork inside. In the winter, her house becomes cold and experiences heat loss through some areas. The roof is made of lead and is bad and old, causing heat loss, emissions and water droplets. The walls and the door of her house have also been damaged and become very bad.

Because of this, Delgermaa is planning to replace them all. She will make the wall insulation using foam, sand and cement and install a new wooden door. Then she will replace the roof with a metal board one. Altogether, it will cost about 4,500,000 MNT in the construction materials markets in Mongolia. She totally believes her family can live comfortably and stay warm at home in winter after the repairs. She is requesting a loan to buy the building materials including the metal board roof, the wooden door and the wall insulation materials for her home repair.

loans.use: to buy the building materials including a metal board roof, a wooden door and wall insulation to repair her house.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en: Arpine lives in Yerevan with her husband and two sons. About three months ago, Arpine started her sewing business and she now needs some investments to promote it. Arpine has applied for this loan to purchase a sewing machine and some fabric. This is important for Arpine to complete current orders and to make higher quality work, which is important for her to stay competitive in the market.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 25-year-old married man, father of one child. He has eight years of experience in motorcycle repair, since he opened his own maintenance shop in 2004.

Kamal is a hard worker, with a very good reputation and experience in this field. He is planning to start a new business; that's why he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy an empty van to use as his new shop. He will also rent an espresso machine, in addition to buying necessary coffee shop needs. He will also buy chairs and tables to make his customers comfortable.

Kamal is a smart man. He will put the van exactly next to his motorcycle repair shop so that people will enjoy his coffee or hot drinks while waiting for their motorcycle to be done.

He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles, and is very excited for this one because it will help him start a business which represents his childhood hobby and dream come true.

He hopes to keep on developing his business for the sake of his family and for pleasing his customers at the same time.

loans.use: To start a new extra business by opening a coffee shop

loans.name: Elver

texts.es:
Elver es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz.
Elver, estudió hasta la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como chofer por más de doce horas y hasta altas horas de la noche, también cuenta con la renta de su otro vehículo ya que con lo que gana debe pagar los gastos de alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus dos vehículos ya que son su única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Elver, es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia y de esa forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Elver is married and has two children who are of school age. They live at his parents’ house where they occupy two rooms. The house is located in the District of Ciudadela Ferroviaria in the city of La Paz.

Elver studied through high school and currently works as a taxi driver for more than 12 hours. He works into the late hours of the evening and also rents out another vehicle. With the money he earns, Elver is able to pay for expenses such as food, education, and basic services for his family. He is requesting a loan to pay for the maintenance of his two vehicles since they are the only source of income that he has to sustain his family.

Elver dreams of having a house of his own so that his family can be more comfortable and have a better quality of life. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.en:
Ubaydullo begins every day with new emotion. He is a person who has perfect ideas and is full of positive energy. He is very sociable and that is why his business has been developing year on year. For more than 12 years Ubaydullo has been a successful business man and has been busy with animal husbandry. He buys cattle, cares for them and then sells them to local people at a low price. He has lots of customers, many of whom are butchers. He does his work perfectly and that’s why his customers enjoy working with him.

Ubaydullo has a lovely wife and four sons. His elder son is married and has a little child. Ubaydullo loves his grandchild very much. He must comfort his family with all modern conveniences and he needs your help for it. He is asking for a loan to buy young cattle for developing his business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, 41, is married with three children and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and she cultivates fruits such as banana and papaya to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and each month she earns 2,800 PHP from this work.

Thelma has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Thelma hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en su vivienda, la cual está ubicada en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. Su comunidad solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la agricultura: Por un lado se dedica a la ganadería, criando ovinos y aves de corral, los cuales vende una vez que han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo. Además cuenta con media hectárea de terreno agricola sembrado de limon que cosecha semanalmente. Todos los productos que logra de sus actividades son vendidos a los negociantes y acopiadores del lugar. Esta labor es la mas común en la zona y constituye la principal actividad de subsistencia en la zona. Ella cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, y su esposo la ayuda durante sus ratos libres.

Carmen se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado y pastos naturales para el engorde de animales y ademas en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limon. Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo como empresaria y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carmen agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 35-year-old mother. She lives together with her husband and her three children in her home, which is located in one of the villages that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. Her community only has basic electricity service.

She works in agriculture-related activities. She works in ranching, raising sheep and poultry and selling them once they have reached a good level of development. She also has a half hectare of farm land planted with lemons which she harvests weekly. All the products from her activities are sold to dealers and middlemen in the area. This work is the most common in this area and is the principal subsistence activity in the area.

She has more than five years of experience in this business and her husband helps her in his spare moments. Carmen is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles that she is planning to use to buy balanced feed and natural pastures to fatten animals and also to buy fertilizer for her lemon crop. This investment will allow her to continue growing as a businesswoman and that way improve her quality of life. Carmen is grateful in advance for the help given.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed y natural pastures to fatten animals and also to buy fertilizers for her lemon crop.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro es un hombre honrado con valores arraigados desde su infancia, ha procreado a 4 hijos maravillosos, trabaja como despachador de diesel en una gasolinera. Actualmente vive con su hija, la cual les da alojamiento a toda su familia (papás y hermanos) pues no tienen casa propia ya, pero el es un hombre responsable y se esta haciendo cargo de todos los gastos de sus hijos procurando que nada les falte. Con el sueldo que el tiene no va poder cubrir los pagos de agosto que son las salidas  mas fuertes de dinero, tiene a tres hijos estudiando y las reinscripciones y los uniformes no son nada  baratos.
texts.en: Alejandro is an honest man who has had good values since his childhood. He has sired 4 marvelous children. He works as a diesel dispatcher in a gas station. Right now he lives with his daughter, who is providing housing for the whole family (parents and children). He doesn't have his own house yet but he is a responsible man and he is taking care of all of his children's expenses, making sure taht they lack for nothing. With the salary he has, he isn't going to be able to cover expenses for August, when his expenses are at their highest. He has three children in school and the re-registries and the uniforms are not cheap.

loans.use: to make payments and for school registries

loans.name: Patricia Veronica

texts.es: PATRICIA TIENE 40 AÑOS ES MADRE SOLTERA CON UNA HIJA DE 21 AÑOS Y CONOCIDA EN EL MEDIO, POR SU LABOR DE VENTA DE ABARROTES, DULCES Y YONQUE. ELLA SIEMPRE HA BUSCADO DARLE LO MEJOR A SU HIJA PARA QUE SALGAN ADELANTE. ES DE ESTA MANERA QUE TUVO LA IDEA DE ESTABLEDER UNA TIENE PARA VENDER PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS BASICOS Y DULCES PARA ABSTERCER A LA COMUNIDAD. ESTE NEGOCIO HA DEMONSTRADO SER RENTABLE Y LA HAN AYUDADO A ELLA Y A SU HIJA A TENER UNA CONDICION DE VIDA DIGNA. ADEMAS ELLA Y SU HIJA, VIVEN CON LA MADRE DE PATRICIA A QUIEN AYUDAN, Y QUIEN AL MISMO TIEMPO COLABORA CON LAS LABORES DE LA TIENDA. BUSCANDO ATENDER DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR ELLA ESTA BUSCANDO UN PRESTAMO DE 2500 SOLES CON EDPYME ALTERNATIVA Y KIVA. CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARÁ MAS MERCADERIA (GOLOSINAS, GASEOSAS, CERVEZA, BOTELLAS DE YONQUE, ETC) PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO Y SU RESPECTIVA VENTA.ELLOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN LA ZONA DE LAMBAYEQUE AL NORTE DEL PERU.
texts.en: Patricia is 40 years old. She is a single mother with a 21 year old daughter. She is know in the area because of her work selling groceries, candies, and yonque [a traditional drink]. She has always sought to giver her daughter the best so that she can get ahead. That is what gave her the idea to open a store to sell basic food products and candies to supply the community. This business has proven to be profitable and it has helped her and her daughter have a dignified life. She and her daughter also live with her mother, whom they help and who collaborates by working at the store. In order to meet an unfilled demand, she is seeking a loan of 2500 soles with EDPYME Alternative and Kiva. With the loan, she will buy more merchandise (snacks, sodas, beer, bottles of Yonque, etc.) to stock her business and to sell. They live in the Lambayque area in northern Peru.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (snacks, sodas, beer, bottles of yonque, etc.) to stock her business and to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more kitchen equipment such as a stove, a cooking pot and a large pan.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 38 year old farmer. She is married to Hendrik, a 47 year old man. Debora and Hendrik are blessed with five children: Novi, 17; Rani, 16; Reza, 12; Iva, 11; and Yano, 5. Four of the children are at school excluding Yano. 

Besides spending her time as a housewife, Debora also assists her husband in generating extra income for their family by cultivating plants at the farm. She cultivates mustard greens, onion, corn, etc. From farming, Debora harvests the vegetables and sell them to the nearest market. The income from selling vegetables is spent on their household needs and the educational needs of her four children. Debora intends to produce more money by cultivating more plants i.e. kangkung or water spinach and chili, but she needs more capital to do so. Debora then submitted a loan application and requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer. She hopes that the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is 57 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with six children. 

Franklin has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. He has had this business for almost three years. He requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock for his general store.

Franklin has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Franklin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his general store.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in Armash village with his two daughters: 18-year-old Lilit and 13-year-old Anna. For many years Ashot has been running a farm, where he cultivates wheat, tomato, eggplant, and grows apricot and peach trees. The current income Ashot gets does not allow him to have enough funds to invest in farming. In particular, Ashot needs to pay for watering the land and the orchard. He also plans to purchase fertilizer to exploit the land and make better conditions for plants and trees. This loan will help Ashot to implement his goals. 

Development of farming is vital for Ashot to have stable income and to make savings for his daughters' further education.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and watering costs.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed is a very hardworking man. He has been busy with growing rice for more than six years. He works hard from early morning till late evening. He likes his work very much and works with pleasure. His wife helps him with the business. They have a child and love him very much. They want to comfort him with all modern conveniences. Jamshed must get more money so he can do this.

He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he works. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Mawe Group

texts.fr: Groupe de solidarité composé du genre masculin comme féminin, l’Association MAWE a pour président Yao. Cultivateur de profession, Yao est marié à une cultivatrice et est père de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Son premier enfant est âgé de 12 ans et le second de 06 ans. Âgé de 35 ans, Yao exerce comme activité la culture du maïs depuis les années 1999 dans son quartier situé dans la région  centrale et ne cesse de faire ses approvisionnement dans la ville de Sokodé. Yao est aidé dans son travail par un membre de sa famille et pour sa première fois, il sollicite le soutien financier de WAGES pour l’achat des outils de travail plus performant. Il compte avec ses revenus supplémentaires construire un logement, assurer le bien être pour ses enfants sans oublier leur éducation scolaire. Comme perspectives d’avenir, Yao pense à augmenter sa superficie cultivable et pérenniser une autosuffisance alimentaire pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawe Group is made up of both men and women. Its president is Yao, a trained cultivator. He's 35 years old, married to a cultivator, and the father of three children, who all go to school. His first child is 12, the second is 6 years old.

Since 1999, Yao has been growing corn in his neighborhood in Central Region, and constantly gets supplies in the town of Sokodé.

In his business, Yao gets help from one family member. For the first time, he is seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy more powerful tools.

With his supplementary income, he intends to build a home, and ensure the well-being and education of his children.

Yao is thinking about expanding his cultivable area in the future to ensure that his family remains food self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel está Casado, tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, nos cuenta que es comerciante, ya que se dedica a la venta de leche y producción de queso.
Nos cuenta que produce 40 a 50 litros de leche por día y de lo que sobra al día produce los quesos que son vendidos hace como mínimo 25 kilos de queso por semana. Además de eso nos cuenta que tiene una buena cantidad de ganado que le ayuda a trabajar y tener sus productos. El es una persona muy trabajadora y que tiene muchas ansias de seguir trabajando y progresando.
Solicita el crédito para comprar 2 vacas lecheras más, para aumentar su producción de leche, y así poder generar más sus ingresos y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel is married, 55 years old, and lives in the city of Curuguaty.  He tells us that he is a merchant since [his occupation is] the sale of milk and the production of cheese.  He explains that he produces 40 to 50 liters of milk per day and from what is left over each day he produces cheeses that are sold; he [is able] to make at least 25 kilos of cheese each week.  In addition to that, he tells us that he has a fair amount of cattle that help him work and [transport] his products.  

[Daniel] is a very hardworking person and has a strong yearning to continue working and progressing. He requests the loan for the purchase of two more dairy cows in order to increase his milk production.  That way, he will be able to generate more revenue and continue helping his family.

loans.use: to purchase diary cows.

loans.name: Itacua Poty Group

texts.es:
Las 17  integrantes trabajan arduamente todos los días, cementan que la fundación paraguaya les ha sido de mucha ayuda por las capacitaciones que reciben, ya que ellas quieren seguir creciendo.
Luz forma parte del grupo,  y cuenta que se dedica a hacer chipas, que es un alimento típico de Paraguay. Comenta que hace años que se dedica a esto y que gracias a esto ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de huevos, grasa, manteca, y demás insumos para seguir haciendo las chipas. Cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma también ayudar a las demás personas que al igual que ella desean progresar.
texts.en:
The 17 members work hard every day.  They mention that Fundación Paraguaya has been of great help to them because of the training they get since they want to continue growing.

Luz is part of the group and she relates that she makes “chipas” which is a traditional Paraguayan food.  She mentions that she’s been doing this for years and thanks to it was able to help her family giving them what they need to live a life that’s free of privations.

She’s asking for the loan to buy eggs, oil, lard and other ingredients needed to continue making chipas.  She relates that her dream is to continue growing in order to help others who also want to make progress like her.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, lard and other supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Lambare Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas de Lambaré” se encuentra en el tercer ciclo y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras en todo lo que necesitan. Son personas que desean salir adelante y tienen gran espíritu de superación.
Lilian una de las miembros del grupo, nos cuenta que es muy humilde, pero muy trabajadora, se dedica al reciclaje de botellas, cartones, aluminio, los cuales vuelve a vender para tener más ganancias. Su meta es seguir ayudando a su familia y que no les falta nada.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cartones, botellas, lo cual revenderá. LIlian está contenta por esta oportunidad, ya que no siempre la recibe y nos cuenta además que esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas de Lambaré” committee is in its third cycle and they are learning to work together and help each other with what they need. They are people who want to get ahead and have a great spirit of overcoming. 

Lilian, one of the members of the group, tells us that she is very humble, but very hardworking. She recycles bottles, cardboard, and aluminum. She re-sells them to make more profit.  Her goal is to keep helping her family so they lack for nothing.

She is asking for the loan to buy cardboard and bottles, which she will re-sell. LIlian is happy with this opportunity, since she doesn't always get them. She also tells us that she is very proud of what she does, because it is dignified work and above all, honest.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, bottles, etc.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah is a 31-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a poultry business  and rental houses selling chickens and providing rental house accomodation . She has been involved in this business for 7 years. 

Isabellah's business is located within a conducive business environment  and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of taxes charged on her business . She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more chickens for resale and pay for the renovation of her rental houses. Her business goal is to build more rental houses for provision of accomodation  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her businesses.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the rental houses and  buy chickens for resale.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 71 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon. She is married with six children. 

To earn a living, Rufina has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Rufina has  requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to be used in purchasing more snacks to sell.

Rufina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Rufina would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more snacks to sell

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is widowed with two children. Anacorita is 66 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela.

Anacorita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Anacorita has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional feed. 

Anacorita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Anacorita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is 25 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Roselle is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Roselle has a business selling snacks and barbecue in the community. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. Roselle has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, salt, etc.

Roselle has been a member of PMPC for one month.  In the future, Roselle would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two young cattle to fatten and also kiosk stock.

loans.name: Purity Masika

texts.en:
Purity  is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children, 2 years old and 6 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman . She operates a food stall where she sells food, snacks and tea. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Purity describes her biggest business challenge to be frequent harassment from local authorities. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for selling. Her business goal is to improve her food stall within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to prepare meals to sell

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Rosita has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. Rosita has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Rosita would like to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 29 years old. She is married.  She is a hardworking woman. She lives in a rural area of Kosovo with her husband and two children. Edita operates a sewing business. She has been a seamstress for the past seven years and makes tablecloths, curtains, skirts, and dresses for her local customers.

Edita  is requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy a new sewing machine and other equipment for her business. Edita has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and with the help of previous loans from KosInvest. 

Edita’s goal is to earn a higher income and to expand her business in a near future. She is happy about the financial support from KosInvest because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family, improving their living conditions and saving money toward her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.en:
Hikmatullo is a very successful person. For more than seven years he has had his own business. He has been busy with driving. He has his own minibus and serves local people to go from one place to another. He has many clients and all of them are glad about his work. 

Hikmatullo has a lovely wife and three little children. He must comfort his family with all modern conveniences alone. His minibus is broken and he is going to repair it. He is asking a loan to repair his minibus. He awaits your help and mercy.

loans.use: To repair his minibus

loans.name: Evans Tokali

texts.en:
Evans is a 23-year-old single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells items such as sugar, salt, flour, wheat flour, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a favorable business environment, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high prices of household items. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy more household products to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is 60 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Lourdes has a store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Lourdes hopes to expand her business. Lourdes is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Clara Fe

texts.en:
Clara Fe is married with eight children. She is 41 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Clara Fe owns a van that she uses in her transportation business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 for van financing. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns about 25,000. 

Clara Fe has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Clara Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: for van financing

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Roger

texts.fr: Roger est un jeune homme de 25 ans fiancé père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 mois et 9 ans. Il est commerçant dans un marché de la capitale depuis 10 ans où il vends des vivres frais (pommes de terre) Il a déjà une bonne expérience dans ce domaine, et augmenter sa clientèle au fil du temps. c'est une activité qu'il prend très au sérieux parce que c'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Il ajuste un problème de capital qui ne lui permet pas d’acheter en grande quantité pour pouvoir détailler. c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce crédit qui permettra de s’acheter cinq sacs de pommes de terre ce augmentera considérablement ses ventes et dont son bénéfice. Il économisera une bonne partie de son bénéfice pour étendre son activité en devenant grossiste, le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Roger, age 25, is engaged and the father of three children, whose ages range from three months to nine years. He's been a merchant in one of the capital's markets for ten years.

He sells food products (potatoes) and already has a lot of experience in this field. Over time, he managed to increase his clientele. He takes his business very seriously, because it enables him to provide for the needs of his family.

He's having a problem at this time: he doesn't have enough capital to buy products wholesale. This is why he's seeking a loan, which will enable him to buy five sacks of potatoes, and considerably increase his sales and profits.

He will put away a large part of his profits in order to expand his business by becoming a wholesaler. The remainder will help him provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of potatoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucila's Group

texts.en:
Lucila is married with five children. Lucila is 62 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Lucila is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to be used in redeeming a parcel of coconut land and for motorcycle repair. 

Lucila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lucila hopes to acquire more parcels of land. Lucila is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming a parcel of coconut land and for motorcycle repair

loans.name: Xhejlane

texts.en:
Xhejlane is an Ashkali woman living in an Ashkali (an Albanian-speaking ethnic minority) community in Kosovo. She is married and has three children. Her community lives under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Children wake up very early in the mornings and go to the trash containers looking for food.

Xhejlane’s family always feels cold and gets sick in winter due to the cold. They have a serious problem with their home's roof, windows and doors. Her house needs a serious renovation so the family can live a healthy and normal life.

Xhejlane has requested a loan to renovate her house and to buy new doors and windows. She hopes this loan will improve the health of her family.

Xhejlane is very grateful to KosInvest lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To renovate her house, to buy new doors and windows
