She dreams of having a larger workshop and augmenting her production and her popularity.  She knows that her strength and the responsibility that she shows every day is what will help her to expand and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like leather and insoles.

loans.name: Virgencita De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El Comite Virgencita de Caacupe esta ubicado en el Chaco, estan en el tercer ciclo, y cuentan que gracias al apoyo en conjunto de todas ellas están saliendo adelante y se ayudan a mejorar su estilo de vida.
La  Sra Ana, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de escobas, y aunque es un trabajo difícil y sacrificado está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es el medio por el cual mantiene a su familia. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de escobas, con lo cual tendrá un buen stock y de esa forma seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus compañeras reciben.
texts.en: The Group "Virgencita de Caacupe" is located in Chaco, they are going through their third cycle, and they tell us that thanks to the support they give each other they are getting ahead and help each other to improve their lifestyle.  Ana is one of the members of the group and sells brooms, even though her job is difficult and she has to make sacrifices she is proud of what she does because it's the way she supports her family.  She requests a loan to buy brooms, to increase her stock and meet the demand of her customers.  She is thankful for the opportunity that her and her group members get.

loans.use: to buy brooms for sale.

loans.name: Progresando Group

texts.es:
El Comite Progresando está en el primer ciclo del programa de la fundación paraguaya. Son 10 mujeres que se han unido para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
Patricia es miembro del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, y cuenta que es un buen negocio ya que últimamente el carbón es muy solicitado ya que el gas es muy caro. Desea poder seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y cubrir los gastos de la casa.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, y de esa forma seguir dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Comite Progresando is in its first loan cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya program. They are 10 women that have united to be able to held each other and through this work, give their children a better future. 

Patricia is one member of the group. She makes a living selling charcoal and has a good business since lately charcoal is in high demand due to gas being very expensive. She hopes to continue working to be able to continue helping her family and covering the household expenses. She is requesting the loan to buy charcoal. In this way she continues giving her family all that they need.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Five years ago, Sharofat began her own business. Her hard work and aspirations help her to be the best in business. She sells national women’s pants in the local market.Sharofat buys fabrics and gives them to seamstresses. They sew pants and then Sharofat sells them. She has many customers as her goods come in a wide assortment. Sharofat has four children and a kind husband. Her husband is also a businessman and he has a lot of work and can’t to help his wife with her business. Sharofat manages her business alone. She wants to develop her business further and that’s why she is asking for a loan to buy fabrics for sewing pants. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who is attached to a printing and binding business. With the loan investment he will buy paper for printing and iron for binding purposes. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for many years. Maqsooda has full confidence in him that he will become more successful in his business after investing the loan.

She is a housewife, remaining at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in an auto workshop while her two younger children are getting their education.

Maqsooda knows the importance of education very well and hopes that she will be able to continue providing education to her children in future.

Note: In the photo the lady raising her hand is Maqsooda.

loans.use: To buy paper and other material for printing and binding business

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina is 42 years old and she is married; she has got seven children, and her husband is a businessman. She has a kiosk in front of her home, to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including coffee, biscuits, soap, cigarettes, and sugar. 

Albina started with her own working capital of $ 200 in 2011. She has a farm to grow vegetables. She hopes that with the income she can build a good house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, biscuits, soap, cigarettes, and sugar.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a newly recognized member of PMPC.  He is married with five adult children.  He is residing in Sawang, Maria, Siquijor.  He is encouraged to be a member of the coop to have financial access for his business.  He intends to use the PMPC loan for additional capital for buying and selling scrap materials. He believes that through hard work with the help of God, he can increase the earnings of the business to save for his retirement.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be an honest and determined woman. She operates a general store where she sells clothes and detergents she makes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more clothes and raw materials for making detergent for sale. Her business goal is to run another general store selling clothes and detergent within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and raw materials for making detergents for selling.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: This time, Eva is borrowing PHP 20,000 to fund her computer rental business. The general store business that she previously funded through Kiva partner, NWTF, continues to provide for Eva and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: To fund her computer rental business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Lilia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns income from raising livestock.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Sor, 45, is a widow mother and has two children. To earn a living, Sor has been selling fish at the traditional market for 10 years. From the current business, she is able to earn about 15,300 KHR per day. Sor has been with VisionFund for three loans already. All the loans, which have helped her to smoothly manage her fish selling business, have been repaid with success. She and her co-member are applying for new loan in amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. Sor, the group leader, will use her portion to buy more fish to resale. She hopes to earn more profit so she can improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sarieng's Group

texts.en:
Sarieng is 34 years old and living in the village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a widow and has two dependent children who are still in school. To support her family, Sarieng has been selling fish and raising pigs for three years. From her current business, she can earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day for her family’s daily needs. 

In this group of two members, Sarieng is the group leader. She has been with VisionFund for seven cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to earn a better living. Now she and her co-member are applying for a new loan of KHR 1,400,000 KHR and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising and fishes for sale. She hopes this loan will enable her to live in proper conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for raising and fishes for sale

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 54 years old and single. He works very hard to provide for his parents and for his nephews. 

Ramon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Ramon has been in this business for 32 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles, etc.. 

In the future Ramon would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Jose Luis

texts.es: El cliente Oscar , es un señor de 23 años de edad, esta casado el cliente trabaja en una empresa de Telecomunicaciones en la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona norte de la ciudad, aproximadamente a 7 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, el cliente vive con su esposa y su familia en anticrético, ambos tienen 1 hijo dependiente y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de mercadería, debido a que su esposa se dedica a la venta de accesorios de limpieza, en la actualidad la mercadería que la cliente maneja esta muy caro, y necesita el capital para el negocio, ya que se esta agotando el contrato de anticrético de la casa donde viven y necesitan mejorar su comercialización para mejorar su estatus de vida.
texts.en:
The client, Oscar, is a 23 year old man. He is married and works in a Telecommunications business in the city of Cochabamba. He currently lives in the northern region of the city, approximately 7 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. The house in which he lives is not his own. He lives in the house with his wife and family on a rent-free basis through the use of an upfront loan which is paid back upon completion of the rental period. 

They have one child who is dependent on them. The purpose of the loan from the institution is to buy merchandise because his wife makes a living selling cleaning accessories. Currently the products that the customer manages is very expensive and needs the capital for the business because the rental contact is exhausting itself. They need to improve their marketing to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cleaning accessories.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.en: Kunduz likes to eat sweets. Eighteen years ago she began her own business selling sweets and biscuits, chocolates, nuts, etc. In the local market she has her own sales venue and a lot of customers. Her colleagues know her as clever and serious. She works hard to develop her business but her income is small. She has six children and a lovely husband. Her children help her with the business. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for developing the business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy biscuits and nuts to expand her business

loans.name: Juleta

texts.en:
Juleta has been engaged in animal breeding and gardening in Lusadzor village for a long time. She rears three cows, three calves, five pigs and some chickens as well. In her garden Juleta grows vegetables and fruit. Juleta's accent is on figs and Oriental persimmons grown for sale. Also she is able to sell produced milk and cheese directly from her house. 

Juleta says that her agricultural business allows her to provide for her family and therefore she intends to develop it. For that reason she is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy one more cow for her farm and also to stock a large lot of fodder for her farm animals.   
 
Juleta is 50 years old. She is married and has two children. Juleta’s daughter is married and she lives separately from her parents. Juleta’s son and his family live with Juleta and they help her with the farming. Juleta’s husband now is living and working in Russia. 

This is Juleta’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her loan repayments.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for her farm and also to stock a large lot of fodder for her farm animals

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, who is 30 years old, has a taxi business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for one year. He is married to Clara and they have two children aged six and one years old.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy spare parts and repair his taxi and keep it in good condition. With the anticipated profits, he plans to buy a plot.

In the future, Benard hopes to grow his business by buying another taxi as well as to make more income and be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Oun is aged 49 years old. She is a married mother of five children, only one of whom is dependent on her and works at the family’s business.

To earn a living, Oun works as a rice farmer. She has been in this business for several years and earns about 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Oun’s group consists of two members who are applying for their first microloans with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Oun is requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000 from VisionFund, while her group member is applying for 800,000 KHR. 

As the leader of the group, she will use her loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make their living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Uimailuma

texts.en: Uimailuma is a 42-year-old woman who is married with one child. She runs a business sewing clothes to sell in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Uimailuma has requested a loan to buy materials, threads and a  electric sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to expand her business from home to town. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads, and a  eletric sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo to raise and sell for meat.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is 47 years old, married, and has two children, ages 16 and 19. She is a restaurant owner from Tangnan, Panglao, Bohol. She and her husband work in their restaurant to make it profitable. 

Magdalina is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy ingredients like fish, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, and three sacks of rice. She dreams of improving her business because her main goal is to see her children graduate from college. A business that is sustainable and profitable will surely help her family to have a good life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, pork, beef, chicken, soft drinks, and three sacks of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables, condiments and spices to sell

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en: Nerie is 51 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nerie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nerie has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Toribio Aniceto

texts.es:
El socio Toribio tiene 46 años de edad y tiene una relación de union libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, él es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador que saca adelante a su hijo pues él se dedica a la elaboración de tejas, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo leña y combustibles. 

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member, Toribio, is 46 years old.  He and his partner have one son.  Toribio lives in the city of Huambutio and belongs to the communal bank “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” of Asociación Arariwa.  Being a part of the communal bank has been going very well for him, thanks to his punctual repayments.  Toribio is a hardworking and entrepreneurial man who is helping his son to get ahead.  Toribio earns his living making tile.  At this time he needs the loan to purchase work materials like firewood and combustibles. 

The member is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase work materials like firewood and combustibles.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania ,la socia cuenta con un local donde vende toda su mercaderia a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como turistas,la socia vende diferentes tipos de mercaderia como chompas,polos,chalinas,guantes entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.
                                                                                           
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is a part of the community banking group “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, a part of the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

She continues to work in her business of craft sales.  She owns a location where she sells all of her merchandise to her customers who are the most eager for her goods, like tourists.  The member sells different kinds of merchandise, like sweaters, polo shirts, scarves, gloves, and other items.  She has spent a lot of time in this line of work, which is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.  This is the way in which she helps out her family.

The bank member is asking for this loan to buy sweaters made of alpaca wool.  She is happy about the loan and promises that she will make timely payments on her loan.

loans.use: to buy sweaters of alpaca wool.

loans.name: Gyna

texts.en: Gyna is a young woman in her very early 20s that lives in Bogor Selatan. Bogor Selatan is a city around 1 hours' driving from Indonesia’s capital city, Jakarta. Although she is young, as in most Indonesian traditional families, she is married and has two children. Her first one has passed away, and now her second child is 2 years old. Gyna owns a small shop selling Indonesian household needs starting with grocery items like rice, eggs, cooking oil and margarine, and going onto toiletries, cleaning tools and, of course, airtime prepaid minute. By selling airtime prepaid minutes, she met with Ruma [Kiva's Field Partner]. Since Ruma began bringing more income into her family by selling the minutes, Gyna agreed to try Ruma’s new product. This new product will help Gyna serve customers better from her shop. It is called a Loket Ruma business. The premise in becoming a Loket Ruma agent is to provide a bill payment service for customers. Gyna hopes that people will come to her shop, not only to buy groceries or prepaid minutes, but also to pay electricity bills and motorcycle installments, to buy electricity vouchers for new house types and, last but not least, to pay credit card bills. She will be using an electronic data capture (EDC) machine to help create the payment transaction. This loan from Kiva will be used to pay the guarantee deposit money for an EDC. The reason she wants to give the new product a try is to expand her business to the next level by maximizing what she can give to her customers. Another thing is: because this is an emerging product in the community. The EDC machine is simple, affordable capital. Ruma’s money collection system allows Gyna to stay in her shop and Ruma’s field officer comes to collect the money to become her capital again. She loves it!

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en: Teresinha is 29 years old and she is married. She has got six children; five of them are studying. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk, so she is taking out a loan of $ 1000 to purchase additional supplies for her store including flour, oil, soap, noodles and animals such as cows, goats, chickens and pigs. She started this business in 2006 with a working capital of $ 300. She wants to buy a car and support her children to get a good education.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, soap, noodles and animals such as cows, goats, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 43 years old. He is married to Lucy and together they have three children. He operates a grocery store and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is his first term loan in KADET LTD. He was introduced by a field officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase onions, potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables for his business.

He hopes to become a dairy farmer in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase onions, potatoes, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 26 years old. He lives in Kechut village with his mother and brother. Vardan is involved in agriculture. He raises cattle and grows apple and pear trees. Vardan has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. He plans to purchase 4 calves. 
Vardan works at a local company as a driver, but the main source of income for him comes from the sales of agricultural products. With the increased number of cattle, Vardan will be able to make and sell more products and gather more income. It is important for this young farmer to sustain his family and put away savings for starting his own family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for calves

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en: Chea is a rural villager from Ou Reang Ov District of the Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is 30 years old and married. Chea grows rice on a 1.5 hectare area of farmland and the main challenges for her business are the lack of water, which cut down her crop yields, and the declining price of paddy rice. To overcome these challenges, she and her other member are seeking for new loan in amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to lease a pump for her rice field and to buy rice seed and fertilizer. Chea expects to receive more crop yields from her current business and improve her life style.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and lease a pump for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Thoeurn is a 51-year-old widow with one daughter. She currently works at a factory and earns minimal wages. To support her household, she has been farming for 32 years and earns about 17,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Thoeurn’s main business challenge is the lack of working capital for her rice farm. To overcome this hardship, she leads a group of two to request a new loan. This is the second loan cycle for Thoeurn and third cycle for the other group member. Thoeurn repaid her first loan successfully and it enabled her to set aside some money for future needs. She is requesting a new loan for 500,000 KHR and her other group member is seeking for 400,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay the harvesting fee. She hopes to expand her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to pay the harvesting fee for her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district
